intro: Hieracium lingua, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers, which are arranged in a single, showy head. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy appearance. Hieracium lingua is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
